info.title: Amazon Pinpoint SMS and Voice Service
info.description: Pinpoint SMS and Voice Messaging public facing APIs

servers.description: The Pinpoint SMS Voice multi-region endpoint
The Pinpoint SMS Voice multi-region endpoint
The Pinpoint SMS Voice endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The Pinpoint SMS Voice endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

schema.description: An empty object that indicates that the configuration set was successfully created.

ConfigurationSetName.description: The name that you want to give the configuration set.

get.description: List all of the configuration sets associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current region.

allOf.description: An array that contains all of the configuration sets in your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.
An object that contains a list of configuration sets for your account in the current region.
A token returned from a previous call to ListConfigurationSets to indicate the position in the list of configuration sets.

schema.description: An object that contains information about the configuration sets for your account in the current region.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: A token returned from a previous call to the API that indicates the position in the list of results.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: Used to specify the number of items that should be returned in the response.

schema.description: An empty object that indicates that the configuration set was deleted successfully.

post.description: Create a new event destination in a configuration set.

schema.description: An empty object that indicates that the event destination was created successfully.

EventDestination.description: An object that defines a single event destination.

allOf.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that is able to write event data to an Amazon CloudWatch destination.
The name of the Amazon CloudWatch Log Group that you want to record events in.

CloudWatchLogsDestination.description: An object that contains information about an event destination that sends data to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

allOf.description: Indicates whether or not the event destination is enabled. If the event destination is enabled, then Amazon Pinpoint sends response data to the specified event destination.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that can write data to an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose stream.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination that you want to use in the event destination.

KinesisFirehoseDestination.description: An object that contains information about an event destination that sends data to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.

MatchingEventTypes.description: An array of EventDestination objects. Each EventDestination object includes ARNs and other information that define an event destination.

items.description: The types of events that are sent to the event destination.

allOf.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic that you want to publish events to.

SnsDestination.description: An object that contains information about an event destination that sends data to Amazon SNS.

EventDestinationName.description: A name that identifies the event destination.

get.description: Obtain information about an event destination, including the types of events it reports, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the destination, and the name of the event destination.

EventDestinations.description: An array of EventDestination objects. Each EventDestination object includes ARNs and other information that define an event destination.

allOf.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that is able to write event data to an Amazon CloudWatch destination.
The name of the Amazon CloudWatch Log Group that you want to record events in.

allOf.description: Indicates whether or not the event destination is enabled. If the event destination is enabled, then Amazon Pinpoint sends response data to the specified event destination.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that can write data to an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose stream.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination that you want to use in the event destination.

KinesisFirehoseDestination.description: An object that contains information about an event destination that sends data to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.

MatchingEventTypes.description: An array of EventDestination objects. Each EventDestination object includes ARNs and other information that define an event destination.

items.description: The types of events that are sent to the event destination.

allOf.description: A name that identifies the event destination configuration.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic that you want to publish events to.

SnsDestination.description: An object that contains information about an event destination that sends data to Amazon SNS.

items.description: An object that defines an event destination.

schema.description: An object that contains information about an event destination.
An empty object that indicates that the event destination was deleted successfully.

put.description: Update an event destination in a configuration set. An event destination is a location that you publish information about your voice calls to. For example, you can log an event to an Amazon CloudWatch destination when a call fails.

schema.description: An empty object that indicates that the event destination was updated successfully.

EventDestination.description: An object that defines a single event destination.

allOf.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that is able to write event data to an Amazon CloudWatch destination.
The name of the Amazon CloudWatch Log Group that you want to record events in.

CloudWatchLogsDestination.description: An object that contains information about an event destination that sends data to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

allOf.description: Indicates whether or not the event destination is enabled. If the event destination is enabled, then Amazon Pinpoint sends response data to the specified event destination.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that can write data to an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose stream.

items.description: The types of events that are sent to the event destination.

allOf.description: A unique identifier for the voice message.

schema.description: An object that that contains the Message ID of a Voice message that was sent successfully.

CallerId.description: The phone number that appears on recipients' devices when they receive the message.

ConfigurationSetName.description: The name of the configuration set that you want to use to send the message.

Content.description: An object that contains a voice message and information about the recipient that you want to send it to.

allOf.description: The language to use when delivering the message. For a complete list of supported languages, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.

CallInstructionsMessage.description: An object that defines a message that contains text formatted using Amazon Pinpoint Voice Instructions markup.

allOf.description: The language to use when delivering the message. For a complete list of supported languages, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
The plain (not SSML-formatted) text to deliver to the recipient.
The name of the voice that you want to use to deliver the message. For a complete list of supported voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.

PlainTextMessage.description: An object that defines a message that contains unformatted text.

allOf.description: The language to use when delivering the message. For a complete list of supported languages, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
The SSML-formatted text to deliver to the recipient.
The name of the voice that you want to use to deliver the message. For a complete list of supported voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.

SSMLMessage.description: An object that defines a message that contains SSML-formatted text.

DestinationPhoneNumber.description: The phone number that you want to send the voice message to.

OriginationPhoneNumber.description: The phone number that Amazon Pinpoint should use to send the voice message. This isn't necessarily the phone number that appears on recipients' devices when they receive the message, because you can specify a CallerId parameter in the request.
